title: SARS-CoV-2 Wastewater RNA Concentration and Extraction (Nanotrap® and NucleoMag® RNA Water)
title_html: SARS-CoV-2 Wastewater RNA Concentration and Extraction (Nanotrap® and NucleoMag® RNA Water)

protocol.title: SARS-CoV-2 Wastewater RNA Concentration and Extraction (Nanotrap® and NucleoMag® RNA Water)
protocol.title_html: SARS-CoV-2 Wastewater RNA Concentration and Extraction (Nanotrap® and NucleoMag® RNA Water)

protocol.title: SARS-CoV-2 Wastewater RNA Concentration and Extraction (Nanotrap® and NucleoMag® RNA Water)
protocol.title_html: SARS-CoV-2 Wastewater RNA Concentration and Extraction (Nanotrap® and NucleoMag® RNA Water)

source.description:
Collect
of wastewater in a 500mL or 1L plastic sample bottle.
Create a 1:100 dilution of Zoetis Bovine Rhinotracheitis-Parainfluzena-Respiratory Syncytial Virus (BRSV) Vaccine in H2O.

Spike the
wastewater sample with
of 1:100 BSRV to achieve a 1µL/mL concentration of 1:100 BSRV.

source.body: This can be applied to wastewater samples greater or less than 500mL, as long as a 1µL/mL concentration is achieved.

source.description: Mix the added 1:100 BRSV into the wastewater sample by aggressively inverting the bottle several times or shaking.

Incubate spiked wastewater samples for a minimum of
at room temperature (RT) to allow large aggregates to sediment at the bottom of the sample bottle.

Use a 25mL serological pipette to transfer top
of spiked wastewater to a 50mL conical tube.

source.body: Make sure to gently transfer from the top of the wastewater sample as to not disturb the sedimented particles at the bottom of the bottle.

source.description:
Add
of Ceres Magnetic Nanotrap® particles to the
spiked wastewater aliquot.
Place conical tubes into custom magnet racks and allow magnets to attract Magnetic Nanotrap® particles for a minimum of 20 minutes at RT.

source.body: The samples should be allowed to sit on the magnets long enough so that the supernatant is relatively clear. Some wastewater samples may be too turbid to reach this point, however.

source.description: Keeping the conical tubes fixed to the magnets, pour off the supernatant carefully as to not disturb the pellet of Magnetic Nanotrap® particles at the bottom of the conical tubes.

Add
of Buffer MWA1 to the falcon tubes.
Vortex to resuspend the Magnetic Nanotrap® pellets in the Buffer MWA1.

Incubate samples for
at RT.
Place conical tubes on the custom magnet racks to separate the Magnetic Nanotrap® particles.
Invert the wastewater samples several times to incorporate the Magnetic Nanotrap® particles and incubate for 20 minutes at RT.

With the tubes on the magnets, transfer
of lysate to a 2mL deep well plate.

source.body: Use barcode labels on the falcon tubes to transfer sample ID's to a LIMS program when transferring lysate to the deep well plate.

source.description:
Add
of Buffer MWA2 and
of NucleoMag® B-Beads to the lysate in the deep well plate.

Shake the sample plate for
at
,
.

Place the sample plate on a plate magnet for at least
to separate NucleoMag® B-beads.

source.body: At each magnet step, allow as much time as needed for the NucleoMag® B-beads to completely precipitate near the magnets.

source.description: Use a multichannel pipette to remove the supernatant from each well.

source.body: Ensure that NucleoMag® B-beads are not removed with the supernatant. If beads are drawn up with the supernatant, dispense the liquid back into the well and incubate on a magnet for a few minutes to allow the NucleoMag® B-beads to settle at the magnet.

source.description:
Add
of Buffer MWA3 to each well.

Shake the sample plate for
at
,
.

Place the sample plate on a plate magnet for at least
to separate NucleoMag® B-beads.
Use a multichannel pipette to remove the supernatant from each well.

Add
of Buffer MWA3 to each well.

Shake the sample plate for
at
,
.

Place the sample plate on a plate magnet for at least
to separate NucleoMag® B-beads.
Use a multichannel pipette to remove the supernatant from each well.

Add
of Buffer MWA4 to each well.

Shake the sample plate for
at
,
.

Place the sample plate on a plate magnet for
to separate NucleoMag® B-beads.
Use a multichannel pipette to remove the supernatant from each well.

source.body: Take extra care to remove as much supernatant as possible at this step. Carryover of the wash buffer can cause PCR/qPCR/library prep to fail.

source.description:
Place plate on shaker at
for approximately 30 minutes to allow beads to air dry.

source.body: Ensure beads are thoroughly dry before proceeding, carry over EtOH from Buffer MWA4 can ruin downstream experiments.

source.description:
Add
of RNase-free H2O to each well.

Shake the sample plate for
at
,
.

Place the sample plate on a plate magnet for
to separate NucleoMag® B-beads.
Transfer eluted RNA to a 96-well elution plate for further processing.
